H0.text: Triploblastic animals may have a body cavity present or absent.

H1.text: Vertebrates are the type of animals in which a body cavity may be present or absent.

H2.text: Bicellular animals may have a body cavity that can be present or absent.

H3.text: Nonvascular animals may have a body cavity present or absent.

A4.text: Some bilaterians lack body cavities, while others have a primary body cavity or a secondary cavity, the coelom.

A5.text: The urbilaterian had a solid body, and all body cavities therefore secondarily arose later in different groups.
